thread.title: Knicks waive Greek Freak’s brother, four others
thread.title_full: Knicks waive Greek Freak’s brother, four others | New York Post

author: Marc Berman
title: Knicks waive Greek Freak’s brother, four others
text:
The Greek Freak’s brother still isn’t ready.
The Knicks will either scour the waiver wire this weekend or go with 14 players to start the season after releasing 2014 second-round pick Thanasis Antetokounmpo and four other players on Friday.
Power forward Darion Atkins, point guard Travis Trice and shooting guard Wesley Saunders were released as expected, and the three undrafted free agents are being targeted for the Knicks’ D-League squad. DaJuan Summers also was released, leaving the Knicks at 14 players, one under the 15-man max.
The Post reported Antetokounmpo, the 6-foot-7 older brother of the Greek Freak, Giannis, received only a $75,000 guarantee, decreasing his chances of making the team. His agents have said the 23-year-old Antetokounmpo didn’t want to play in the D-League again and they have spoken to European teams. Antetokounmpo told The Post last week he still is hoping another NBA team would pick him up, but only the Bucks, his brother’s team, can be considered a viable option.
Antetokounmpo played in three preseason games, recording four rebounds and two assists over 13 total minutes. He was drafted 51st overall, but never developed enough of an offensive game.
